availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John D. Miller (Ohio County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Ohio County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of William Miller and Mary Miller. Married to Frances E. Wilson Miller in Ohio County, Kentucky, on March 9, 1854. Father of Mary F. Miller, Mahala E. Miller, Susan J. Miller, George W. Miller, and Joseph M. Miller. Farmer in Ohio County in 1850. Farmer in Ohio County in 1860. Farmer in Ohio County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, District 1, p. 35B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, Caney, p. 718.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, Caney, p. 351A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Ohio County, KY, July 1863, p. 36.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Ohio County Marriages, Film #000494956, p. 143.
"John Denham Miller (1829-1899)," Find A Grave, Memorial #111922657, accessed October 2, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/111922657.
KYR-0001-031-0032.
